awd_titl_txt: The Oxygen Balance at Equatorial Pacific JGOFS Time Series  Sites
awd_abstract_narration: The U.S. Joint Global Ocean Flux Study is proposing an inquiry                  into the cycling of carbon and other bioactive elements in the                  central Equatorial Pacific Ocean.  With respect to the upper                    water column, key objectives include (1) understanding controls                 on primary production, which appears anomalously low study given                the high nutrient concentrations present in the waters;  (2)                    understanding new production in terms of limitations on                         phytoplankton growth and pathways of carbon cycling within the                  ecosystems; and (3) studying changes in fluxes and ecodynamics                  resulting from seasonal and interannual changes in physical                     forcing.                                                                                                                                                        This project will measure net and gross O2 production at 2o N,                  Oo, and 2o S during cruises in fall, 1991 and spring, 1992.  Net                production from the change of ıO2! will be measured in samples                  incubated for 24 hours.  Gross production by spiking will also be               measured in seawater samples with H218O and measuring the                       production rate of 18O - labelled O2.
